RequestGroup.description: A group is a single organization that is an end customer of a vendor app

id.description: The id of this group in the vendor app's data model

RequestActor.description: An actor is the person or identity (like an API token) that performed the action

id.description: The id of this actor in the vendor app's data model

href.description:
A url to view this actor in the vendor app.
Can be referenced in Retraced [Display Templates](https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/advanced/display-templates)
to create an interactive embedded viewer experience.

RequestTarget.description: A target is the object upon which the action is performed

id.description: The id of this target in the vendor app's data model

href.description:
A url to view this target in the vendor app.
Can be referenced in Retraced
to create an interactive embedded viewer experience.

action.description: The action that occured e.g. `user.login` or `spreadsheet.create`

crud.description: Denotes whether this is a "Create", "Read", "Update", or "Delete" event.

created.description: ISO8601 date string representing when this event occurent. `created` will be tracked in addtion to `received`

source_ip.description: The source IP address from which the event was initiated

description.description: A human-readable description of the event

is_anonymous.description: Denotes whether this event was anonymous. Must be `true` if `actor` is absent

is_failure.description: Denotes whether this event represents a failure to perform the action

fields.description: An optional set of additional arbitrary event about the data

component.description: An identifier for the vendor app component that sent the event

version.description: An identifier for the version of the vendor app that sent the event, usually a git SHA

external_id.description: An identifier for the environment in which the event was sent

metadata.description: An optional set of additional metadata  about the data

display_name.description: the display name for the token

view_log_action.description: The `action` name that will be used to record usages of this token. Defaults to `audit.log.view`

display_name.description: the display name for the token

view_log_action.description: The `action` name that will be used to record usages of this token. Defaults to `audit.log.view`

query.description:
Structured search query. For example,

`edit` -- free text search
`action:users.list` -- search by action
`action:document.* location:Germany` -- search by action and location
`actor.id:john.doe@mycompany.com` -- search by actor id

last.description: The number of events to return

before.description: An opaque cursor that represents the offset to query since. Should be empty for an initial request to the API. Responses from GraphQL endpoints will include the cursor value to use to fetch the next page of data.

query.description:
Graphql Search query string. See https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/apis/graphql#search
for an example query

variables.description: Search parameters for filtering, limit and offset

operationName.description: The GraphQL operation name. Optional, defaults to standard event search.

id.description: The ID of the created search

saved_search_id.description: An id of an existing saved search to use

id.description: `id` is the id of the saved search. Can be used to initiate an active search

actions.description: `actions` is an optional array of action ids to search over

actor_ids.description: `actor_ids` is an optional array of actors to search over

start.description: `start` is an optional ISO8601 formatted date to search since

Partial_ApiTokenValues_.description: Make all properties in T optional

info.title: retraced
info.description: A fully open source audit log service and embeddable UI easily deployed to your own Kubernetes cluster

post.description:
Create an event. Returns the id of the created event, and
a cryptographic hash of the received event, as described at
https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/architecture/hashing-formula

parameters.description: auth header of the form token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

post.description:
Create one or more events. Returns a list of the ids of the created event and
a cryptographic hash of each received events, as described at
https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/architecture/hashing-formula

parameters.description: auth header of the form token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

get.description:
Create a token for use with the Retraced embedded viewer as described at

https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/getting-started/embedded-viewer

**Note**: At least one of `group_id` or `team_id` is required.

parameters.description: auth header of the form token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The group identifier. Same as `team_id`. If both are passed, `group_id` will be used.
parameters.name: group_id

parameters.description: Whether to display the Enterprise Settings and API Token Management. Set to `true` to show the settings.
parameters.name: is_admin

parameters.description: If passed, only events relating to this target will be returned in a viewer that uses the token created
parameters.name: target_id

parameters.description: Same as `group_id`. If both are passed, `group_id` will be used. This field is deprecated.
parameters.name: team_id

parameters.description: The action that will be logged when the token is used
parameters.name: view_log_action

post.description:
Create a token for use with Enterprise IT API

https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/apis/enterprise-api

parameters.description: auth header of the form token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: The group identifier. The generated token will be scoped to the specified group.
parameters.name: groupId

requestBody.description: The details for creating the token

schema.description: The details for creating the token

get.description:
List all Enterprise IT API tokens.

https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/apis/enterprise-api

parameters.description: auth header of the form token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

get.description:
Retrieve an Enterprise IT API token.

https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/apis/enterprise-api

parameters.description: auth header of the form token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

put.description:
Update an Enterprise IT API token

https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/apis/enterprise-api

parameters.description: auth header of the form token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

delete.description:
Delete an Enterprise IT API token

https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/apis/enterprise-api

parameters.description: auth header of the form token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: auth header of the form Token token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: auth header of the form Token token= ...
parameters.name: Authorization

post.description:
Initiate an active search. An active search will maintain
a persistent cursor that can be used at a later date to
retrieve additional events from the search.


Authenticate with an Enterprise API token.

Create a saved search.
Saved searches have an ID that can be used to initiate an active search.

Authenticate with an Enterprise API token.
Create an invite. Sends an invitation email to the user.

requestBody.description: The invite resource with the invitee's email

schema.description: The invite resource with the invitee's email

post.description:
Create a template. An overview of Template usage in Retraced can be found at

https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/advanced/display-templates

get.description:
Search templates. An overview of Template usage in Retraced can be found at

https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/advanced/display-templates

parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return
parameters.name: length

delete.description:
Delete a template. An overview of Template usage in Retraced can be found at

https://boxyhq.com/docs/retraced/advanced/display-templates

parameters.description: The id of the template to delete
parameters.name: templateId

delete.description:
Delete an environment and all of its dependents.
This is only allowed if
1) the environment is empty (i.e. it lacks any recorded events), or
2) an outstanding "deletion request" has been approved.

post.description:
Create a resource deletion request and associated confirmation
requirements (as necessary).

get.description: Get the current status of an outstanding deletion request.

parameters.description: The id of the deletion request to look up
parameters.name: deletionRequestId

post.description: Mark a deletion confirmation as received (i.e. approve it).

Create an admin token. An Admin Token can be used to impersonate a user,
and will have access to all the user's projects, environments, and events.
